definition: grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
to recommend sb/to give a referral
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to propose (for a job)/to nominate/to recommend
Qi Xi's recommendation (idiom); recommending the best person for the job independent of factional loyalty
court crown beneath straw shoe (idiom); everything turned upside down
sacrum (bone at the base of the spine)

sentences.english: So, I'll give a lecture titled《I Commend My Heart to the Lofty Thill》.
sentences.chinese: 为此，我作如下演讲，题目是《我以我心荐轩辕》。

sentences.english: It is an important part of library reading tutorship work to recommend readers to read poems and articles.
sentences.chinese: 诗文荐读是图书馆阅读辅导工作的重要内容之一。

sentences.english: to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
sentences.chinese: 好在神面前把自己荐与各人的良心。

sentences.english: After water, then roll cast from the swirl of the boat, but right.
sentences.chinese: 经过水漩，则掷荐投之，舟乃无恙。

definition: high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to pocket a lost article/(fig.) to correct others' errors/to remedy omissions (in a text etc)
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to serve as an official/an official/the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 將|将[jiang4]
example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
